subject: RE: [junit] suppressing test cases from base class in an extended class
msgSnippet: Instead of suppressing base class methods, how about extracting the common setup to a setup base class, thus: class MySetup extends TestCase { public void
messageBody:
Instead of suppressing base class methods, how about extracting the
common setup to a setup base class, thus:

class MySetup extends TestCase
{
public void setUp() {}
public void tearDown() {}
}

class A extends MySetup
{
public testA() {}
}

class B extends MySetup
{
public testB() {}
}

Manuel Amago.
mailto:mamago@...


> I have an existing test case class which I extended to add
> few more test cases. When I run the extended test case, it
> runs the test cases from the base class as well. Is there a
> flag or something which I can use to suppress running test
> cases present in the base class.
> Here's an example of the scenario :
...
>
> When I execute class B, it runs both testA() and testB(),
> which I want to avoid for now. I need to extend to be able to
> use the setup/teardown done by A.
